qas.question: During which years did Melbourne experience an economic downturn?
Which city is the center of Australia's "rust belt"?
The Australian Grand Prix moved to Melbourne from where?
Which government in 1992 began a campaign to revive the economy?

context: As the centre of Australia's "rust belt", <a1_0>Melbourne<a1_0/> experienced an economic downturn between <a0_0>1989 to 1992<a0_0/>, following the collapse of several local financial institutions. In 1992 the newly elected <a3_0>Kennett<a3_0/> government began a campaign to revive the economy with an aggressive development campaign of public works coupled with the promotion of the city as a tourist destination with a focus on major events and sports tourism. During this period the Australian Grand Prix moved to Melbourne from <a2_0>Adelaide<a2_0/>. Major projects included the construction of a new facility for the Melbourne Museum, Federation Square, the Melbourne Exhibition and Convention Centre, Crown Casino and the CityLink tollway. Other strategies included the privatisation of some of Melbourne's services, including power and public transport, and a reduction in funding to public services such as health, education and public transport infrastructure.
